jot.io.device

Interface TrackableInput

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Input
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Mouse

    public interface TrackableInput
extends Input
    Interface that specifies the core methods to implement for a generic trackable input handler.
    Author:
    G. Amador & A. Gomes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getAcceleration()
      Get the acceleration in of a generic device cursor, e.g., for a Wiimote its roll, pitch, and yaw, etc.
      org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getPosition()
      Get the position in 3D Cartesian space of a generic device cursor, e.g., for a Wiimote its a X, Y, Z coordinate, for a mouse its the mouse cursor X and Y values, etc.
      org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getPositionShift()
      Get the difference between a generic device cursor current and old position.

      • Methods inherited from interface jot.io.device.Input

        isContinuouslyDetecting, isDetecting, registerInputEvent

    • Method Detail

      • getAcceleration

        org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getAcceleration()
        Get the acceleration in of a generic device cursor, e.g., for a Wiimote its roll, pitch, and yaw, etc.
        Returns:
        X, Y, and Z coordinates of generic cursor.

      • getPosition

        org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getPosition()
        Get the position in 3D Cartesian space of a generic device cursor, e.g., for a Wiimote its a X, Y, Z coordinate, for a mouse its the mouse cursor X and Y values, etc.
        Returns:
        X, Y, and Z coordinates of generic cursor.

      • getPositionShift

        org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Vector3D getPositionShift()
        Get the difference between a generic device cursor current and old position.
        Returns:
        the difference between generic device cursor current and old position.
